{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3307384,"name":"","username":"enc0unt3r","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/enc0unt3r/{size}/202939_2.png","created_at":"2024-02-12T02:00:13.758Z","cooked":"

Hi guys. I am currently working on a NetworkTable Project and I plan to run a Java program on the driver’s laptop, but, probably due to the inability to surf smoothly across docs, I don’t know how to create such a Java program that can be built and run independently on a laptop. I now have gradle 8.6 installed on my computer.

Any help is welcome!

FIRST Robotics Competition Documentation

Creating a Client-side Program

If all you need to do is have your robot program communicate with a COTS coprocessor or a dashboard running on the Driver Station laptop, then the previous examples of writing robot programs are su...

I read it and found that it contains just the source code and a build.gradle file. Should I put my code and build.gradle under my project directory and run “gradle build” in my cmd?
